column1: Amursk (Russian: Аму́рск) is a town in Khabarovsk Krai
column3: located on the left bank of the Amur River 45 kilometers (28 mi) south of Komsomolsk-on-Amur. Population: 42

column1: It was founded as an urban-type settlement on June 19
column3: in connection with the construction of a pulp mill near the Nanai settlement Padali. Town status was granted to it in 1973.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Amursk serves as the administrative center of Amursky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column4: it is incorporated separately as the town of krai significance of Amursk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: Amursk is incorporated within Amursky Municipal District as Amursk Urban Settlement.
